content:
I've just edited the statement based on the comment in the forum ( https://forum.codingame.com/t/community-puzzle-sky-maze-adventures-1/198330/9 ). The main changes are as follows:

Goal
* Mentioned that "starting position" is part of what is given.

* Formatted the actions in the example using <action> tags.

* A few minor changes in the text.

Initialization input
* A few minor changes in the text.

Input for a game round
* Mentioned that "In the first round, this denotes the starting position." (see @VilBoub's comment below)

Output for a game round
* Added "for a game round" to the title of this section.

* Formatted the actions using <action> tags.

* Changed "changing the width and height of the player" to "moving the player’s position by 1 unit in the corresponding direction".

* Deleted "All output must be capital."

Constraints
* Rewrote this section entirely.
You need to update the description to explain that the starting position is only given in the loop!
Um, the top left corner is 0,0...

Simple maze, there are others alike, but requires some algorithm to search path. Some typos (already pointed out). The maze doesn't change once the game starts, so no need to run on "turns", but  not a big problem for the idea. I like it. Thanks for the efforts

❌ Rejected the contribution.
Comment: One more maze. This one brings nothing compared to the others. The fact of knowing the current position is of no use since in principle the path is found in the first round, when the starting position is known. Only the graphics are original, in my opinion it is insufficient to validate it.

Output section
* "changing the width and height of the player" should be changed to "changing the position of the player".
* "All outputs must be capital." may be deleted.

Constraints section
* "1<=w,h,dx,dy,x,y<50" Should be revised as:
1 ≤ [[w]], [[h]] < 50
0 ≤ [[dx]], [[x]] < [[w]]
0 ≤ [[dy]], [[y]] < [[h]]

Thanks.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I liked the sky animation and well it is not original, but quite a good exercice to learn a new language for example (statement was clear enough for me)
Oof there's an error where all the 1s are #s.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Not first "maze" puzzle here..., but i like sky animation ;o)

And consider tweaking description of Example @ "Goal" section -> its not clear that there will be input of current x,y coords after each step as described @ "Input for a game round"

// all tests/validators passed
I learned Java for this one.
